docs.snippet: The steamship Empire City, from New-York 2d inst, vid Havana 9th inst., has arrived at the Balize. She connected at Havana with the steamship Granada from Aspinwall, and brings the California mails of the 20th ult. The steamship Star of the West left...

headline.main: TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.; Surrender of Col. Anderson, &c. $1,600,000 in Treasure en route. IMPORTANT FROM NICARAGUA. Arrival of the Empire City at New-Orleans.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Empire City, from New-York 2d inst, vid Havana 9th inst., has arrived at the Balize. She connected at Havana with the steamship Granada from Aspinwall, and brings the California mails of the 20th ult. The steamship Star of the West left Aspinwall on the 4th for New-York direct, with the California mails and $1,600,000 in treasure. The U. S. steamer Fulton, Lieut.

docs.snippet: The Vice-President laid before the Senate a communication from the Secretary of War, inclosing exports of the surveys of the rivers and the haroors on the lakes in the State of New-York. Mr. SEWARD presented the petition of CHRISTIAN HANSEN, praying...

headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS .......First Session.; SENATE ASSEMBLY NEW - YORK LEGISLATURE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Vice-President laid before the Senate a communication from the Secretary of War, inclosing exports of the surveys of the rivers and the haroors on the lakes in the State of New-York. Mr. SEWARD presented the petition of CHRISTIAN HANSEN, praying Congress to establish an ocean mail route between New-York and Gluckstadt on the Elbe. Referred to the Committee on the Post-Office.

headline.main: MUNICIPAL.; BOARD OF ALDERMEN. ANNUAL REPORT OF THE CORPORATION COUNSEL Communication from D.D. Conover-Alleged Discovery of Immense Frauds in the Street Department. The Street-Cleaning Contract Declared illegal. Mayor Tiemann on the Results of the Battery Enlargement.

docs.snippet: Mr. JOHN UPTON, a well-known Express agent on the Albany youte, and Segeant-at-Arms to the Congressional Investigating Committee in Kansas, died at Amsterdam, N.Y., on Saturday, His health was shattered by server exposure while protecting his trucks...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. JOHN UPTON, a well-known Express agent on the Albany youte, and Segeant-at-Arms to the Congressional Investigating Committee in Kansas, died at Amsterdam, N.Y., on Saturday, His health was shattered by server exposure while protecting his trucks in the Express car of the Hudson River railroad at the time of the Spayten Duynil accident when the extenex was interseiy cold.

docs.snippet: Genera! Orders, No. 1: The General-in-Chief, with the approbation of the War Department, directs the following movements: 1. The army of Utah will be reinforced, as soon as practicable, by the Ist Regiment of Cavalry, 6th and 7th Regiments of...

headline.main: Important Army Orders.; REINFORCEMENTS FOR THE UTAH EXPEDITION.

docs.lead_paragraph: Genera! Orders, No. 1: The General-in-Chief, with the approbation of the War Department, directs the following movements: 1. The army of Utah will be reinforced, as soon as practicable, by the Ist Regiment of Cavalry, 6th and 7th Regiments of Infaitry, and Light Companics A and M.2d Artillery.

docs.snippet: DANCER TO THE ICE CROP.--May weather in mid-Winter is very pleasant, and a great blessing to the poor, as well as to invalids; but it is not profitable, nor healthy, in the long run.
docs.lead_paragraph: DANCER TO THE ICE CROP.--May weather in mid-Winter is very pleasant, and a great blessing to the poor, as well as to invalids; but it is not profitable, nor healthy, in the long run.

docs.snippet: JAMES P. DONNELLY was yesterday executed for the murder of ALBERT S. MOSES. The circumstances attending the commission of the crime for which he has suffered,--full account of them, as developed at the trial, was published in the TIMES,--the...

headline.main: EXECUTION OF DONNELLY.; From Our Own Correspondent. THE FINAL SCENE. He Protests his Innocence and Accuses Another of the Murder. LAST ACT OF THE NEVISINK TRAGEDY. Preparations for the Execution--The Prisoner's Family Take Leave of Him. DONNELLY's DYING SPEECH.

docs.lead_paragraph: JAMES P. DONNELLY was yesterday executed for the murder of ALBERT S. MOSES. The circumstances attending the commission of the crime for which he has suffered,--full account of them, as developed at the trial, was published in the TIMES,--the respectable connections, prepossessing appearance, talents and acquirements of the unfortunate, young man, while they have produced a feeling of deep commiseration throughout this community, have yet rather added to than softened the feeling against him.
